Submitting an Assignment or Miniassignment

All homework is submitted on Blackboard by attaching a zip archive of your Java source files. For miniassignments, the zip file is created by the SpecChecker. For regular assignments, you may need to create the zip file yourself.

The document "Assignment Submission HOWTO" describes in detail how to submit an assignment to Blackboard, how to check that the submission was correct, and also how to create a zip file of your Java project when necessary.

Take a look at the first section of that document now. Follow the instructions to submit your zip file (created by the SpecChecker on the previous page) on Blackboard as "Lab 1 practice submission".

Log into Blackboard at https://bb.its.iastate.edu using your ISU NetID and password. You can find the "Lab 1 practice submission" link on Blackboard on the "Homework" page for Com S 227.

Checkpoint 3

  1. Show the TA your Submission History Page on Blackboard for "Lab 1 practice submission" with the uploaded zip file.
  2. Demonstrate that you can download the zip file into a temporary directory, and open it to examine its contents (in Windows you can normally just double-click on it). There should be one directory called "lab1" with one file called "Greeter.java".
